definition: lit. an arrow at the end of its flight (idiom)/fig. spent force
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
stubborn/unyielding
surname Qiang
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
crossbow
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
tip/end/final stage/latter part/inessential detail/powder/dust/opera role of old man

sentences.english: We've been a spent bullet for the love.
sentences.chinese: 在情感上已經是強弩之末。

sentences.english: They are not yet a spent force, but time is running out for them very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 他們還未到強弩之末，但是時機在快速驅離他們。

sentences.english: But his doctors admit it's a long shot .
sentences.chinese: 然而他的醫生承認這是強弩之末。

sentences.english: We have been a spent bullet for the love.
sentences.chinese: 在情感上已經是強弩之末。

definition: economic difficulty
doddering/senile
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
sudden thrust (that catches the opponent off guard)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]
lit. like a sheet of loose sand/fig. unable to cooperate (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
superficial wound/a bruise
to slap/to smack/to punch
to heave a sigh of relief
a short time/a little while
to win by a surprise move
victory is in sight
out of ammunition and no food left (idiom); in desperate straits
